name: expectation_with_polynomial_and_stirling
author: 陈嘉乐
summary: Given n balls initially white, two rounds of random coloring (each time m balls are chosen), we compute the expected value of a polynomial F(A), where A is the smallest index of a black ball. The answer is E[F(A)] × C(n,m)^2 mod 998244353. The solution involves combinatorics, Stirling numbers, binomial inversion, generating functions, and polynomial techniques to handle large n and m efficiently.
